keyword: calories in an extra large egg
title: Calories in an Extra Large Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in an extra large egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in an Extra Large Egg
assumptions: Extra large egg (~56 g), raw or hard-boiled, no added salt, oil, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, freshness, farming method, and preparation; check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: An extra large egg provides ~80 kcal and ~7 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in an extra large egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 80 kcal for one extra large egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in an extra large egg?
faqs.a: About 7 g of high-quality protein per egg.

faqs.q: Do extra large eggs have more calories than large ones?
faqs.a: Yes, ~80 kcal vs. ~70-78 kcal for a large egg due to greater size.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in an extra large egg?
faqs.a: Raw, boiled, or poached keep calories similar (~80 kcal); frying adds ~40+ kcal from oil.

faqs.q: Why is cholesterol high in an extra large egg?
faqs.a: The yolk contains ~210 mg cholesterol, but dietary impact varies by individual health.
